### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:When eating everything on the tasting menu, what does one tend to feel? Choices:  A: full stomach B: getting full C: gaining weight D: sick E: satisfaction<n>Output:		A: getting full<n>  <n>### Explanation:<n><n>In Question (1), C does not say you could not be thirsty for the water fountain, but it talks about what would be the water fountain (you can go to an outside water fountain when running out of water in order to quench your thirst), so option (B), own home, is more likely the correct option.<n><n>In Question (2), it is quite obvious that getting full is the correct answer as when eating everything in the tasting menu is quite impossible: for the food in the tasting menus is too much (so you would certainly get full; you can not eat everything all the time).<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:He waited for his friend at the squash court, but he was worried his friend thought he meant the at the other end of the public what? Choices:  A: country club B: rich person's house C: pool D: park E: fitness center<n>Output:		A: pool<n><n>### The Solution Process<n><n>To answer the question, you need to have at least a slight understanding of sourcing your source. The solution to the first problem is that since they have a problem with water supply, they do not have a function for plumbing they can use. They would rather use a fountain where they drink the water, but their plumbing does not work for any use.<n><n>### The Answer<n><n>```java<n>class Solution {<n>    public String answer(String question){<n>        String response = "";<n>        //We have two strings. One is used for the answer and one is used for the possible answers.<n><n>        //Iterate through the set while checking if it meets our criteria (If it meets the criteria, we add it to an ArrayList.)<n>        for(String s : wordList) {<n>            boolean isA = false; //Used for checking if the correct answer is the same as the substring we found.<n>            boolean isB = false;<n>            if(s.toLowerCase().contains(question.toLowerCase())) {<n>                System.out.println("Found substring: " + s);<n>                //Found substring. Now we check if it is a answer or a possible answer.<n>                for(String a : answerList) {<n>                    if(s.contains(a)){<n>                        System.out.println(a);<n>                        isA = true;<n>                        isB = false; //resetting the boolean we found for<n>                    }<n>                    if(a.toLowerCase().matches(question)){<n>                        isB=true;<n>                    }<n>                }<n><n>                if(s.toUpperCase().contains(question) || a.toUpperCase().matches(question)) isA = true; //Checking for case insensitivity<n>                if (isA &&!isB) {<n>                    //If not, you are correct.<n>                    String correctAnswer = question.toUpperCase();<n>                    if(isA){<n>                        correctAnswer = s.toUpperCase();//If it works, change the answer to that substring we found.<n>                    }else{<n>                        correctAnswer="B";<n>                    }<n><n>                    System.out.println("#answer"+question);<n>                    response = response + correctAnswer;

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:People want to explore space, so what should they use to do it? Choices:  A: public place B: roadblock C: space shuttle D: hoverboard E: supermarket<n>Output:		A: public place<n><n>### Solution:<n>```python<n>import os<n>import re<n><n><n>def is_string(s_obj):<n>    # Check if the given object is an object that can be a string<n>    # or a sub-object which can be a string<n><n>    _has_attr = True<n><n>    # Check if it has all the following attributes<n>    # str: str object<n>    # __len__: len funciton<n>    try:<n>        if not ("__len__" in s_obj and bool(re.search("str",str(s_obj)) and <n>        _has_attr)):<n>            return False<n>    except:<n>        return None<n>    <n>    return True<n><n>## Part One<n># Part 1.<n>def is_letter(l_obj):<n>    if is_string(l_obj) == False:<n>        return False<n>    else:<n>        try:<n>            _index = l_obj.find(" ")<n>        except:<n>            return False<n>        if _index:<n>            return False <n>        else:<n>            return True<n><n>print("Check the results against the question!")<n>print("Letter: ",is_letter("Hello"))<n>print("String: ",is_string("Hello"))<n><n><n>## Part Two<n># Part 2.<n>### Instruction:<n># If it was so easy to reach a destination, there would be no such thing as traffic on the <n># roads and an extremely large percentage of people would travel by road. Therefore <n># we would only require the ability to drive a car or a motorcycle.<n># If a road is no longer being used, its purpose is to travel by walking at. <n>#<n># Answer for this question is not part of the task. But it is a remind that a road is really a <n># pathway for pedestrians, not a highway for vehicles.<n>#<n>#<n><n>## Answer Key<n># Part 2<n><n><n># Part 3<n># Part 3.<n>### Instructions:<n># There are a lot of different uses for a shovel. You could use it to dig a hole in the ground <n># and put your plants in, you could use it to take out the trash from the house or you could <n># use it to

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices: 	A: Julia Child B: Betty Crocker C: Bebe Foster D: Martha Washington <n>Output:A: Julia Child<n><n>### Code:Use the following code to solve the problem:<n>#### Code 1:  <n>from math import ceil, ceil<n># Import Math Functions<n>p=ceil(len(words))<n><n>#Get the values of each word<n>wordlist1 = [0,0,0]<n>wordlist2 = [0,0]<n>for i in range(len(words)):<n>    wordlist1[i]+=words[i]<n>    <n>for i in range (0,p-1):<n>    if wordlist1[i]=="C":<n>        wordlist2[str(i)=="C":<n>        print "C"<n>print "A"<n>print "B"<n>print "C"<n>for i in range(-5,5):<n>    if wordlists=i:<n>        print i<n>print "D"<n>print "E"<n>print "F"<n>print "G"<n>### Notes:The program is complete and does not need correction

Choices: <n>A: rain B: fog C: wind D: sunshine <n>Output: B:fog<n><n><n>### Solution:<n><n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>## 3.  Problem <n>The code will loop until the first value is equal to 0.<n>Input: If i was twice as long as j, how long would i be? Choices:<n>A: 2j <n>B: 3j <n>C: 4j <n>D:4j + 3j<n>E:4j - 3j<n>Output: A: 2j  <n><n>#2<n>The code will not only loop until the first value in the input and the value in the loop will be 0, but also only accept the valid answer.<n>Input: If 2 times j had minus j, how long would 2 times j be? Choices: 7A. 1 7B. 2 12A. -2 7B. 4<n>Output: 7B: 2<n><n>#3<n>The code will not accept invalid entries for the first value.<n>Input:If j was twice as long as h, how long would each be? Choices:A: 2h <n>B: 2h + j <n>C: 2j 6h(h = i) <n>D:2h - i <n>E: 2j + h <n>Output:B: 2h+j(h=i)<n><n>#4<n>The loop will repeat the same set of instructions, until the value in the loop becomes 0. We can loop here until the first 0, so it will not work for input 4 or 2. The answer of the first case input is 0. The answer of the second case input is 4.<n>Input: If a = b+2a and b=2b, then b = Choices: 5(a)2 (b)2  i (c) c (d) a (e)b b<n>Output: C: c<n>

Choices:  "A: department store safe deposit box B:  lady's boudoirs C: these two are ways of transporting an engagemment ring D: these three are safe ways of transportring an engagement ring"<n>Output: B:  lady'st boudoir<n><n>### Hints:<n><n>If you have not used it in practice, now is the time. <n><n>You might have to take advantage of some built-in regex functions to do the task.<n><n>### Test:<n><n><n>```<n>input : What is not a safe  way of transporting an  engagement ring?<n>      Choices:  "a: department store safe deposite box b:  lady's  boudoirs c: these two are ways  transporting engagement ring d: these three are  safe ways transport an engagement ring".<n>    Output: b:  lady'st  boudoir<n>```<n><n>### Hidden Input<n><n>```<n>Input  :"D. These three are safe ways transport an engemment ring"<n>Output: "D: these three are way ways transporting engagement an ring"<n>```<n><n>## 7. A. Create a **set** that contain string of four characters that are **not** an English sentence.<n><n>### Hinds<n><n>If a 4 character string is illegal, and there could be any number of them for any character combination, consider it
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:James thought that giving the AI a secular upbringing would be the better choice.  He felt that the alternative might have results that were too what? Choices:  A: eternal B: religious C: unpredictable D: holy E: monastic<n>Output:		A: eternal<n>Input:If two people have a disagreement about a statement like "It's never my fault", that person will likely say which of the following? Choices: 1: I'm always right A: True  B: False  C: Incorrect <n>Output: B: False<n><n>```<n>#!/bin/bash<n><n>read val case=$1<n><n>if [[ $case = 0 ]] ; then<n>    output=val<n>else<n>    case1=($(echo $val | awk '{print $1}'))<n>    case2=($val | awk '{print  $1}'))<n><n>    if (( val -case1 ) < 0 -and val -case2 < 0) ; then<n>        output=val<n>    else<n>        case1=($( echo $val | awk '{for (i=1; i <= $1;i++){print i}}'))<n>        case2=($(echo $input | awk '{for (n=1; n <= <n>        $1;n++){print n}}'))<n>        if (( $input -$case1 ) <n>         <  0 -and $input -$case2 < 0 -and $val -$case1 < 0 -$input -$case2<n>         <  0 )then<n>            output=$val<n>        fi<n>    fi<n>fi<n>echo $output<n>```<n><n>```<n>1. Where could you find some Plumbing that would not Be of use to you if  you are thirsty, Answer: A<n>2. James thought that Giving the AI a Secular upbringing was the Better choice. He Felt that the Alternative Would have Results that were too what? : A<n>3. What would Happen if two people have disagreement about a Statement like it's never my Fault? Answer:B<n>```<n><n>output for 4.<n><n>If the user chooses 2, then the out would be <n><n>```<n>1)True; if the input=4, val=3<n>2)True; if the user chose 0, then the output for val=0 and input=3 is True.<n>output for a<n>output for b<n>```

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:A yard is made up of what? Choices:  A: city B: michigan C: three feet D: subdivision E: three arm span<n>Output:		A: three feet<n><n>Input: A city is made up of what types? Choices:  a: houses b: plumbs c: people, trees, etc<n>Output: a: houses<n><n>### Code:<n><n>var city= "New York";<n><n>if(city=="city")<n>{<n>    return('A city is made up of types like plubs, people, etc');<n>}<n>else if(city=="house")<n>{<n>    console.log("A house is made up of walls, flooring (wood, carpet, etc), windows, doors, stairs, ceilings, (plumbing, kitchen, bathroom, electrical, furniture (including appliances), etc.");<n>}<n>else if (city=="plubs")<n>{<n>    if(city=="city")   <n>    {<n>        return("A city is made of types like plumbing, people, etc");<n>    }<n>    else if (city=="house")<n>    {<n>        if (city=="plumbs")<n>        {<n>          return("A house is made of walls, flooring(woodcarpet etc), windows, doors stairs ceilings");<n>        }<n>        else    <n>        { <n>            console.log("A city is made up types like plubs");<n>        }        <n>    }<n>}

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:If I wanted to thank someone for saying I have done a good job, what would I do? Choices:  A: smile B: shake hands C: express gratitude D: say you're welcome E: appreciate compliment<n>Output:		A: smile<n><n>## Challenge<n><n>Input:A: A computer A: a house<n><n>B: A: computer B: house<n><n>C: A: a house B: computer<n><n>D: A: a computer B: a house<n><n>E: A: computer B. computer<n><n>Output: B: C: F: D:<n><n>## Explanation<n><n>In the first question it requires you to choose the one answer that a plumber would not need after he drinks some water. So the best answer would be oil refineries. In the second question you have to choose the statement which would be a polite way to reply of somebody complimented you on your work (A: express gratitude, B: shake hands, C: smile). In the last question the user has 6 different options to choose the wrong answers. The first question will display the answer in the last 2 characters of the array. The second and the last will display the number of correct and wrong answers.<n><n>## Hint<n>```<n><n>## Instant Solutions<n><n>For the first question, you have to determine user's input and display the element in position 'input'. <n><n>For the second question, you have to loop through the array and determine the index of user's input. <n><n>For the last question, you have to just count the total and display the correct answer.<n><n>## Result<n><n>![](./images/result.png)<n><n>## Solution<n><n>```html-preview<n><script type="text/javascript" src="index.js"></script><n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:Why might a person take a vacation? Choices:  A: relaxation B: good things in life C: admiration D: own house E: needs money<n>Output:		A: relaxation<n><n>### Task 1:<n>```python<n>def plumbing_answer(inp):<n>    if inp == 'oil refineries':<n>        return a<n>    if inp=='own home':<n>        return b<n>    if inp>=5:<n>        return c<n><n><n>def vacate_answer(inp,b):<n>    if in =='relaxation':<n>        return a    <n>    if in =='good things':<n>        return b    <n>    if in=='admiration':<n>        return c    <n>```<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>### Task2<n>```python<n>def vacate_answere_2(inp,b,a):<n>    if in >=5:<n>        if in < 40:                                #If the total sum of days is less than 40,then take that value as return<n>            return a         <n>        else:                                       #If the total sum is greater than 40, then take that total sum as return<n>            return b             <n>```<n><n>output:<n><n>```python<n>    >>> vacate_answer('vacation',24)<n>   'relaxation'<n><n>    >>> plumbing_answer('own home')<n>    'own home'<n><n>    >>> vacate answer(4,12,'good things in life',15)<n>    'good things in life'<n>    >>> vacate answered(4,12,40,5)<n>   'relaxaton'<n>    >>> plumb_answer('own home','own home')<n>    ''<n>    >>> plumb answered('oil refineries','own home')<n>    <n>```

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:What planet is the atlantic ocean part of? Choices:  A: planet B: basin C: submarines D: earth E: pacific<n>Output:		A: planet<n><n>### Solution:<n>> ```python<n>> Q =  ['plumbing','ocean']<n>> A = []<n>> for i in Q:<n>> 	A.append([i,i in i])<n>> 	#print(A) #to see the list after append<n>> ```<n>><n><n>### 1.<n>> ```python<n>>>> A = Input("\n\nWhere could you find some plumbers that would not be of any use to be if you are thirst? (the answers are letters: A to D.) B: own home",True)<n>>>> print(A)<n>>>><n>>>> B = [letter for letter in A if (letter in A and letter >= 'A' and letter <= 'D') and letter not in letter]<n>>>> print(B)<n>[D]<n>```<n>> -------------<n><n>### 2.<n>> ```python =<n>>>> A = []<n>>>> for i in Q[0]:<n>>>> 	A.extend([(i,i in i)])<n>>>> 	#print (A)<n>>>> 	<n>>>> B = []<n>>>> 	for i in A:<n>>>> 		if (i[1]==True):<n>>>> 	 	B.append(i[0])<n>>>>  B.sort()<n>>>>  print(B)<n>>>> <n>>>>  ```

Choices: A: make noise B band C: museum D concert hall E: rub<n>Output: B: band<n>```<n><n>### Instructions and input information<n><n>**Input:**<n>```sql<n>WHERE (WHERE, IS, NOT, (WHERE, IS, PERMEABL<n>```<n><n>**Instructions:**<n>```sql <n>SELECT DISTINCT TERNARY FUNCTION: Choose the type of logical clause in each question and click the "Check Answer" button.<n>```<n><n>**Input: Select the type of logical clause from the dropdown menu for the following set of questions.**<n>```sql<n>1. A: Where in the human body is the urine dis charged? (A: NOT, B: WHERE  C: PERMEABL)<n>2. A: Can you hear an air compressor in silence? (A: WHERE, B PERMEABL C: NOT)<n>3. A: Where do you find an accordion when it is not being musically played? (A: WHEREB: NOT, C: PERMEABLE)<n>4. Which of the following statements is an unconditional sentence? (A: C, B:A, C: B)<n><n>```<n>```sql<n>SELECT DISTINCT<n>  TYPE: B INSTRUCTIONS: SELECT the type of logical clause that is provided in the input string. (A: WHERE  B: NOT C: PERMEA BL)<n>OUTPUT : B<n>SELECT DISTINCT INSTRUCTIONS : SELECT the type of logical clauses in the input string.  (A: WHERE,B: NOT) <n>OUTPUT:  A<n>SELECT DISTINCT B: PERMEA C: NOT D: <n>INPUT: A-WHEREB: PERMEABLEC: NOT <n>OUTPUT: D: WHERE<n>SELECT DISTINCT. And you are getting rid of one of a broken iceboxes.<n>| D |       |      |        |

Describe  a  programming  language that has  some  similarities  to  Python and  some  different  features<n><n>#### 41. 	I know I was previously using Python to write a program but now I want to move to Java but cannot figure out how. What should I do?<n><n>My solution:<n><n>In the first part I used `print` to print the text, I then used `time.sleep()` to make the page load and then `exit()` to make the game finish.<n><n>In the second part you have to choose the answer and then click the button to print it out.<n><n>I used dictionary to allow you to be able to input the answer to the questions and then to print the answer out.<n><n>__This exercise did require more coding, rather than using a dictionary I could have stored the answers but for some reason I thought it would be more efficient for storing it into a dictionary.<n><n>```<n>import urllib.request,urllib<n><n><n>url = 'https://www.google.com/search?q=javascript+programming&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&ved=0AhUKEwjJlYiVo6vbAhXFgqQKHUGTAaAQ_AUICygC&biw=1112&bih=1391'<n>response = urllib.request.urlopen(url).read()<n><n>html = response.decode('utf-8')<n><n>images=re.findall('\</img',html)<n>final = ''<n><n>for image in images:<n>    print(image)<n>    final = final + '<img src="'+image.replace("</img>","img"+str(len(images)))+'">'<n><n>with open('html.html','w',encoding='utf-8') as outfile:<n>    outfile.writelines(final)<n><n>    #https://www.w3schools.com/howto/howto_js_create_image.asp<n><n>url ='https://www.wowhead.com/classic/zone=5&item=1'<n>response =urllib.request.urlopenn(url).read()  <n><n>    #https: //python.net/

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:What could you add a line to? We start at the root of the tree and traverse through the tree using the following steps:<n>(S)et the root node to visited = true(N)ext if the root child of the root is NOT visited go to step (S)et rootnode = current(E)xited (S)et root node = current (N)ext if the next child is NOT visited go to (S)et root = current (E)xited (N)ext set root = current (F)orward (L)ock (Q)ueue (M)ark a node has been visited (I)ncrement a node on the queue (S)et root to null (E)xited<n><n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:The man wanted to take a bus, but all the chars were full of people doing what? Choices:  A: sitting down B: refusing C: saving money D: sit down E: go outdoors<n>Output:		C: sitting down<n><n>Input: The man wanted to take a businessman for a day's wage but he was to stubborn to accept the man's price Choices: A: cheaper than expected B: too high C: refused D: offer to increase the rate E: too low<n>Output: C: refused<n>---<n>### Instruction:Write a complete code for the below question.<n>---<n>""""<n>In java<n><n>```<n>import java.io.BufferedReader;<n>import java.io.*;<n>import java.util.StringTokenizer;<n>class FileWriteRead<n>{<n>//BufferedReader takes care of the characters<n>BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in));<n>String str = "";<n><n>//Read from the file<n>try<n>{<n>FileReader read = new FileReader("FileName");<n>BufferedReader fr = new BufferedReader(read);<n><n>//Use a method for reading the file<n>//StringTokenizer class is used to get values from a string<n>//String value = strToken.nextToken();<n>String split = "";<n>StringTokenizer readFromFile = new StringTokenizer(fr.readLine(), " ");<n>int num = 0;<n><n>while (readFromFile.hasMoreTokens())<n>{<n>String value = readFromFile.nextToken();<n>split = value.split(" ");<n>int i = Integer.parseInt(split[0]);<n>}<n>System.out.println("\n The values and the number of values are " + num);<n><n>//Close the input files<n>fr.close();<n>}<n>catch (Exception e)<n>{<n>e.printStackTrace();<n>}<n><n>//Write the values to the file<n>try<n> {<n>FileWriter fw = new FileWriter("AnotherFileName");<n>BufferedWriter fw2 = new BufferedWriter(fw);<n><n>//Method to write each values to a string<n>for (i = 0; i < num; i++)<n>{<n>fw2.write(num + " " + String.valueOf(split[0]) + " ");<n>fw2.write(" ");<n>fw2.newLine();<n><n>System.out.print("The values is at line " + String.valueOf ( i + 1 ));<n>}<n> }<n>catch (Exception e){<n>    e.printStackTrace(System.err

Choices: A : a big head B: smart C: dumb<n>Output: A: smart <n><n>Input: Which of the following is made from plastic? Choices: 1. a cup 2. a toy 3. a plastic container 4. a pen 5. a toy 6. a cup Answer: 1, 2, 5, 6.<n>Output: 1,2,5,6<n><n>Input: A: Someone who works in a jewelry shop is called a jeweler. Choices: 1: b) 2: c) 3: c) 4: d) 5: b) 6: d) 7: b) 8: a) 9: c) 10: b) <n>Output: 1: b 2: d 3: d 4: c 5: b 6: d 7: b 8: c 9: b 10: c<n><n>## Questions:<n><n>#How many ways of solving the problems above did you figure out?<n><n>##Solution 1:<n><n>#Solution One<n><n>from collections import defaultdict<n><n># create a dictionary to hold the number of choices given, but only for the first key<n>nouns = defaultdict(lambda: 0)<n><n>def valid(words: list[str]):<n>    if not all(word in nouns for word in words):<n>        return False<n>    nouns[word] += 1<n>    return True<n><n># 1: valid(['oil refineries'])<n>nouns is a dictionary that stores the number of occurrences of a noun.<n>for each word in words in input, increase the value key(word) by 1.<n><n>words = ["oil", "refineries"]<n>key = "oil refineries"<n>input = "Where could you find some plum
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:where do children play a game? Choices:  A: toy store B: bar C: casino D: table E: family room<n>Output:		A: toy store<n><n>Input: you don&apos;t want to be ___ a raisin? Choices:  a: alone b: lonely<n> Output: a: alone<n><n>### Explain the output of following code<n><n>#!/bin/python<n><n># Problem Statement: Given an array of distinct integers, return a permutation of the numbers where each value is in a different position.<n><n># Input:<n><n># [3, 8, 4, 10, 9, 5, 2]<n><n># Output:<n><n># [5, 2, 9, 8, 3, 4, 6, 7, 10]<n><n>import collections<n><n><n>class Solution:<n>    def shuffleArray(self, A: List[int]) -> List[int]:<n>        # Solution:<n>        # We start by sorting the array in ascending order.<n>        <n>        # Second, we iterate our sorted array and keep iterating the previous <n>        # element in ascending order. If the next element is greater than the <n>        # existing element, we move the current element to the left. If <n>        # not we move the current element by one spot.<n>        <n>        A.sort()<n>        res = []<n>        i = 0<n>        while i < len(A):<n>            if A[i] >= A[i-1]:<n>                i += 1<n>            else:<n>                res.append(A[i])<n>                i += 2<n>        return res<n><n>result = Solution().shuffleArray([3, 8,4,10,9,5,2])<n>print result<n>

These items can be used for the different levels of the game.<n><n>### Inputs:<n><n>A: Choosing an item for the different levels that will allow one access to that item<n><n>B: Choosing an item<n><n>###  Outputs<n><n>A: Allowing one to use the item<n><n><n>###  Input:<n><n>Choose an item and name how to use it.<n><n>Input: What is your preferred game? Choices:  A)oil refineries  B)wall  C)show  D)own home  E)water fountain\n");<n>	scanf("%d%c",&a,&e);<n>	printf("Input :Where canthe legs ofastoolbe built? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:If I screw a chain ring onto something, what am I fixing? Choices:  A: necklace B: wall outlet fixture C: tool box D: computer E: motorcycle<n>Output:		A: necklace<n><n>Input: If the water from the shower was put on the floor, would it be used for plumbing? Choices: 	A: Yes B: No<n>Output: A: No<n><n>Input:  Would you be using the plumbing under your house if you were thirsty? Choice:  A: No B: I’m not sure C: Yes<n>Output: A: Yes<n><n>Input: Water flows from a lake into a glass. Choices:  A.The force of gravity will make the water go in all directions B: The force of gravity will have all the water flow in one direction  C: It has no effect on water that is already in the container D: It will make the water level rise in the container a little E: It will keep the level of water in the container from rising.<n>Output: A: The force of gravity <n><n>## Challenge<n><n>In the plumbing world, all pipe is measured by its diameter. To get a plumber to estimate how much water will flow through your faucet, he will use the formula for cross-sectional area.<n><n>The formula for cross-section area is $$ A = \pi r^2 $$ <n><n>Given a pipe with a diameter of 9/16th inches, calculate the cross-sectional area in square mm. <n><n>**Input:**<n>```<n>d = 5/16""<n><n>```<n><n>## Solution<n>```<n>answer = 0.0524<n><n>import time<n><n>start = time.clock()<n><n>answer = pi * 5/16 ** 2<n><n>elapsed = time.clock() - start<n><n>print ('The answer is ',answer)<n>print ('The execution time was ', elapsed)<n>```<n><n>## Result<n>```<n>The execution time was  0.0003038431702634046<n>The answer is  0.008838696020099136<n>```
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:Where would you find some swords in your house? Choices:  A: sheath B: sword closet C: collection D: container called scabbard E: museum<n>Output:		A: sheath <n>This is a question about the meaning of the word 'use', specifically in context to the expression 'useful'. The words 'of use' is a phrase that is used to refer to something being of benefit to someone. This fits with the fact that plumbing is used in building homes and therefore used in your own home. Similarly, a sword could be used to protect. In the second example, the word 'use' is used to refer to the way something feels, which is very different from the word's usual use of being of benefit. The plumbing cannot be used to satisfy thirst as it is water (not the refinery) that is needed.<n><n>### [solution](https://github.com/chris6999/leetcode/blob/main/day_12_solutions/solutions_0134.py)<n><n>```python<n>import re<n>class Solution:<n>    def findTheOne(self, words: List[str]) -> str:<n>        <n>        return re.findall(r'(\w+)\s?([^0-9]+)',' '.join(words).split())[-1]<n>s = Solution()<n>ans = s.findTheOne(["oil refineries", "own home", "water fountain", "wall", "thirsty", "show", "own home",<n>                    "museum", "collection", "sword closet", "sheath", "scabbard", "benefit"])<n>print(ans)<n>ans = s.full(["oil refinery", "sword", "sword closett", "own home", <n>            "own homes", "sword closets", "own your home", "use", "shaped like a sword", "sheath",<n>                    "usefully shaped like a sword",<n>                    "sword collection", "sword in your house", "useful shaped like a sword"]<n>	)<n>print(ans)

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices: A B C D E <n><n>Output: A<n><n>#include <iostream><n>#include <stdexcept><n><n>using namespace std;<n><n>class OddOrEven {<n>    int numToCheck;<n><n>    public:<n>        OddOrEven():numToCheck(0){}<n>        void setValue(int value)<n>        {<n>               numToCheck = value;<n>        }<n>        void check()<n>        {<n>            if (numToCheck % 2!= 0) {<n>                cout << "odd" << "\n";<n>            }<n>            else{<n>                cout <<"even" << "\n";               <n>            }            <n>        }<n>};<n><n>int main(int argv, char const* argc[])<n>{<n>    OddOrEven oddOrEven;<n>    int value;<n>    cin >> value;<n><n>    if (value!= 0){<n>        oddOrEven.setValue(value);<n>        oddOrEiven.check();     <n>    }<n>    else{<n>        throw runtime_error("need to provide an int value");<n>    }<n><n>    return 0;<n>}<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:What do humans do when they want to reproduce? Choices:  A: eat ice cream B: have sex C: sit down D: make mistakes E: hear sounds<n>Output:		C: have sex<n><n>Input: What is the average size of a car? Choices: 0: 6 1: 6 2: 7 3: 6 4: 19 5: 22 6: 22 7: 101 Choices:<n>Output: 3: 6<n><n>## How does the code work?<n><n>### Instruction:Explain the algorithm behind your working code.<n><n>>The code works by running through a for loop and checks each element in a list, each element in turn is checked using a second for loop. The elements contained in the second for loop are compared with the result of the first for loop. The first for loop contains 2 numbers. If the first for loop finds that both are true, then the second for loop is used to find what the elements are, for example:<n><n>```python<n>a = [6, 19, 22]<n>b = [0, 22, 6]<n>c = -1<n>```<n><n>so the first for loop is:<n><n>```python <n>i = 0<n>while i < len(a):<n>    if a[i] == 6 and a[i] == b[i]:<n>        i += 1<n>        c = 0<n>        c += int(a[i])<n>```<n>In the first while loop, a variable "i" is set to 0, then checked if "i" (index or the number of elements) is smaller than or equal to the length of "a" or "b" list, whichever is shorter (the one with greater number of elements), where every single element of these two lists will be checked individually. If the condition is true, then the second while loop will work for that element, otherwise, it will just continue to work on the next element. The condition of the second while loop is as follows: as long as the current value of "i" is smaller than or equal the length of the list, that is, as long as "i" is smaller or equal to zero, it will enter the third "if" condition. The third "if" condition is when two elements of the same value are next to each other, the first element with a value of 19, the second with 22. Since "c" variable was set to "-1"

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:The wheel was loose, and threatened to fall off when they were what? Choices:  A: footloose B: sailing C: fast D: tighten E: bind<n>Output:		E<n>Given a sequence of integers, write a function with 4 arguments that finds the minimum index of the array at which all elements are greater than or equal to<n><n>```javascript<n>function minIndex(array, min, lo, hi)<n>{<n>    for (let i=lo; i<hi; i++) if (array[i]>=min) return i;<n>    return lo;<n>}<n>```<n><n># 31<n>Another version of the same thing you can write it is:<n><n>```javascript<n>return minIndex(array,(x[x.length -1]).x)<n>```<n><n>Input:You are standing with your toes hanging over the edge of a 1,000-foot. As you begin to step off, the ground drops away. If you are trying to find out what is wrong with the ground, what can you say? Choices:  a) it had been eroded by the river b) it should not be wet c) it is at ground level d) the ground must be solid e) it is on a boat<n>Output: E<n><n>Input:You buy a used car that has a broken transmission, a blown head gasket, and a leaking timing belt. If one were to ask you to describe what the car was like, what would you likely reply? Choices: 1.It is not very good.<n><n>#<n>Input:You have a 1,010-foot tower. Choices: 200.<n><n>Input:When you mix the three liquids together, they make a brown mixture. How are the liquids related? B: One is a type or apple, another is a types of squash, the third is a type of water and the fourth is another kind of pumpkin.<n><n>```javascript<n><n>//  C++<n>#include <bits/stdc++.h><n><n>using namespace std;<n><n>struct S{<n>    // 50 is 3rd value.<n><n>    int find_min(int m[],

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:The woman experienced great joy, but despite that this was a what? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:What would a person do if he or she wanted to get good grades? Choices:  A: feel proud B: try to learn C: need assistance D: thank god E: read alot<n>Output:		C: need assistance<n><n>Input:What does the "e" in e-mail stand for? Choices:  a) electronic b) english c) e-greetings d) el dorado e) elon<n>Output: a) electronic<n><n>Input:Does all humans have a heart? Choices:  C: yes b) no a) yes anf no b) yes c)yes anf no d) no<n>Output: b) yes<n><n>Input:Where would a human see if they're eating something they love? Choices:  B: the menu C: eyes d) the tv, e) their own head<n>Output: C: eyes<n><n>Input:Who could be considered a good friend? Choices:  e) nobody f) all d) friends a) enemies<n>Output: d) friends<n><n>Input:What could someone do to make themselves healthier? Choices:  c) read a book d) learn to count, a) eat more b) exercise<n>Output: a) eat more<n><n>Input:How can you tell what grade someone might get if the students were graded from best to worst? Choices:  d) worst to best b) best A) from worst to best e ) from best to worst<n>Output: b) best<n><n>### Solution:<n>```python<n>def get_answer(question, choice_dictionary):<n>    x = question<n>    possible_answers_list = [i for i in choice_dictionary.values()] + ['D', 'E']<n>    possible_answsers = choice(possible_answers_list, k = 5)[0:5]<n>    if x in possible_answers_dict:<n>        return choice_dictionary[x]<n>    else:<n>        print("\n\n")<n>        for ans_choice in possible_answers:<n>            if ans_choice in choice_dictionary:<n>                return choice_dictionary[ans_choice]<n>            else:<n>                get_answer(ans_choice, choice_dictionary)<n>            <n>```

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices: 	A: looking into their eyes B: seeing if they are smiling C: hearing if they have a voice D: hearing if they have an accent E: recognizing their voice<n>Output: E: recognizing their  voice<n><n>#!/bin/python<n>import sys<n><n># Get all user's lines via sys.stdin<n>for line in sys.stdin:<n>	# Get the line in a list<n>	line = line.split()<n>	# Get all characters of the list<n>	char = line[9]<n>	# Check if the letter is uppercase or not<n>	if(char[1] == chr(33) and char[5] == chr(59)):<n>		# If case then letter is uppercase<n>		print("Uppercase")<n>	else:<n>		# If not case then letter is lower case<n>		print("Lowercase")<n><n><n>### Tests<n><n><n>print ("Test case 1")<n>answer = input("Please choose an answer from the following choices. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:If you're standing in line and the line isn't moving what might you feel? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:I need a person to milk a cow would a volunteer do this? Choices:  A: cross street B: milk cow C: lose weight D: step forward E: need food<n>Output:		A: cross street<n><n>Input:How good of a salesman is 10% off? Choices:  a: not good b: terrible c: great d: excellent e: outstanding<n>Output:b: terrible<n><n>Input:What kind of animal lives on a farm that has a truck? Choices: 2 trucks 3 cars 4 tractors A) horse B) horse 5 jeeps 6 horse<n>Output:5 jeeps<n><n>Input: A pile of hay is stacked on six logs. How many feet of hay piled on six logs? Choices: 1 foot 2 foot 3 wood 4 wood 5 log<n>Output:4 wood<n><n>---<n><n>### Problem Description:<n>Design a program to determine the amount of hay stacked into a stack. Design another program to determine the average height of the logs.<n><n>---<n>### Solution:<n><n>```python<n>#!/usr/bin/env python3.4<n><n>import sys<n>import math<n><n>def hayLog():<n>	try:<n>		x=input("How many logs? ")<n>	except:<n>		print("Please enter the correct number")<n>#	x=input("Logs to be stacked? ")<n>	while math.floor(math.pow(x,-2))!=0:<n>		print(type(math.pow(1, -3)))<n>		x=x-math.pow(1,-3)<n>	print(math.ceil(math.pow(4,x)))<n>	return 0<n><n>def hayHay():<n>	try:x=input("How much Hay? ")<n>	except :<n>		print("how much hay?")<n>	while not math.floor(math,10)//=10:<n>		x+=-math.floor(math.power10[1])<n>	return x<n><n># hayLog()    <n># hayHay<n>```<n><n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:I wanted  a side chair for people to visit me while I worked, where did I have it put? Choices:  A: building B: office C: library D: table E: bathtub<n>Output:		A: building<n><n>### Solution<n><n>```python<n>def solve(q):<n>    if q == 0: return  'Finished'<n>    <n>    q = int(q)<n><n>    if (q > 0):<n>        q -= 1<n>        return 'a'.join(solve(q) for q in range(0, q+1, 2))<n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:Where are people likely to find food? Choices:  A: opera B: supermarket C: building D: conference E: apartment<n>Output:		A: supermarket<n><n>Input: What can you see in an observatory? Choices: <n>  A: telescope B: sky C: planets D: stars E: satellites<n>Output: A: telescope<n>![Image of question 1](https://github.com/Ashfaq-Umar-Ghauri/Question-5/blob/main/_question/image1.png)<n><n><br><n><n>---<n><n><n><n><n>## How to Answer:<n><n>### Step 1: Write a for loop like below.<n><n>---<n>```<n>for x in (choices[index["choice"]]<n>```<n><n>### Step Two: <n><n>Then write a if statement like below to check if choice exists in string.<n><n>---<n><n>```<n>if x in string:<n>	print(x)<n>```<n><n>## Step 2:<n>Input <n><n>```<n>A<n>```<n><n>Output<n><n>```<n>A is not in this set.<n>```<n><n>## Steps 3:<n><n>---<n>### Step 3: Now write<n>```<n>a = choices[index["choice"]][x]<n>```<n><n>After a is defined, write an if statement like below to print the answer by the length of<n><n>---<n>```if len(a) == 2:<n>    print('Answer is')<n>else:<n>    print('Not an answer')<n>    break<n>```<n><n>## Test 3:<n><n>```<n>where are people likely to find water?<n>Choice: A<n>Choices:  A: building B: own home C: water fountain D: wall E: supermarket<n><n>A<n>```<n>Output<n>Where can you find water? Choices:  B: own home C  water fountain D  wall A: building<n><n>---<n>## Test 4:<n><n>```<n>what can you see in an astronomical observatory?<n>Choice: A | B | C | D | E<n>A: C:  sky  B: telescope D: planets E: stars<n><n>B<n>```<n>Output<n>```<n>What can you  see in an astronomical...?<n>Choices:  B: planets C  stars D: telescope E: sky<n><n>```<n><n>## Thanks for Reading the Post<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? One question(without any answer choice). <n>### 2. Multiple choices. <n>### 3. All choices are words, not sentences. <n>###   There might be more than one correct answer for some questions.<n>###  <n>### Instruction:<n>###  Answer the question, but do not repeat the question in the answer.<n>###  You can take any reasonable number of hints, but if you can't find any, you lose the game.<n>###  Do not use the internet as a resource.<n>###  Each time you use a hint, press enter and you will be prompted to answer the following question. <n>### **Hint 1:** Where could you find plumbing that would be useless to you if you are _thirsty_?<n>### Hint 2: <n>### Hint3:<n>### After this point the word you have a question and need to answer it<n>if you are thirsty) plumbing is useless.<n>Where does everyone buy a ticket to a train station? to a fairgrounds? to a cathedral?<n><n><n>## Solution<n><n>```python<n>#!/usr/bin/python3<n><n>import os<n>import argparse<n>from tqdm import tqdm<n><n># Input data<n>parser = argparse.ArgumentParser()<n>parser.add_argument('-i','--input_file',  <n>                    type=str, default='examples_data/input.txt',<n>                    help='Path to input file')<n>args = parser.parse_args()<n>INPUT = open(args.input_file, 'r').read()<n><n><n># Functions<n>def read_input(input_data):<n>    '''<n>    Read Input File and returns all question and answer in separated arrays<n>    '''<n>    # Split questions and answers based on where the next space occurs or <n>    # where the next endline occurs<n>    # We'll make use of regex here, for example, with the re.findall:<n>    # https://docs.python.org/3.3/tutorial/re.html#examples<n>    questions = re.findall(r'(?<=Where)\s\w+?

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:Where would you sit in a chair to watch four-legged animals complete? Choices:  A: bookstore B: house C: race track D: friend's house E: building<n>Output:		A: house<n><n>![](https://assets.codewars.com/asset/b355aeed-3389-42b7-9d22-50b348a2624d.jpg)<n><n>### Solution<n><n>Bruce.<n><n>I did not find any use of it. Sorry.<n><n>Answer: \section{C++  166 112}<n><n>\begin{code}<n>#include <string><n>#include <sstream><n>#include <iostream><n>#include <vector><n>#include <cstring> // strlen()<n>#include <fstream><n>#include "utility.h"  <n>#define MAX_SIZE 60<n><n>using namespace std;<n>//#define T(s) #s<n>//#define debug(x) {tstringstream y;y << x; cout << T(y.str());}<n>//#define debug2(x) {debug(x),cout <<"\n";}<n>#define vfill(x,y)fill(x, x+y, 0)<n>#define vfillc(x,y)vfill(x, y)<n><n>struct item{<n>    string loc[4];<n>    int size[4];<n>    item(const string& tp){<n>        vector<string> vec = tokenize(tp," ");<n>        string s;<n>        for (int i=0; i<4;i++)<n>            s += vec.back();<n>        size[0] = s.size();<n>        loc[0] = tp;<n>        vec.pop_back();<n>        for (int j=0; j<vec.size();j++) {<n>            s += vec[j];<n>            size[j+1] = s.size() - 1;<n>            loc[j+1] += s;<n>        }<n>    }<n><n>    //const int size() const {<n>    //    int sz;<n>    //    for (int i=1; i<4; i++) sz -= size[i];<n>    //    return sz;<n>    //}<n>};<n><n>const static string TOP("TOP");<n>const static string MID("MID");<n>const static string BOT("BOT

If the following statement is true then these following words come together to construct a "function statement that will execute". This function will return the value of pi multiplied by four (4)<n>  x + 1 if the input to this function is 24, then the outupt is 25.6.<n><n>pi x 4 where x is a number<n><n>## What are methods (or class functions) and where would they come into play?<n>## What other ways can the code be interpreted?<n><n>### Important: What are conditions and logical operators?<n>### Input: In what condition would you give a value to the variable p, where the value is 3 or a float number? <n>## Output:  p = 3 if p is a float number.  (It can never equal 3 because an integer number will never equal a float value.) Also, if the value is 3 then you do not need to enter a parenthesis, but if the condition is not an integer it must be entered (because an integer has type of a primitive data type that can't be change in Java whereas float is a reference type data type that can be changed). <n>## Important: How are logic operators applied in the following code segments and not the first case? <n>### Instruction answer the following questions.  How do these logic operators work? what would the code return? Can an else condition be assigned within the if statement? Which operator would you use instead of the and or the if statements? What would the code return? <n>Input: x = 3; y = 5<n>Output: y = 7; <n><n>if (x%y

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:The old barn was beyond repair, they had to destroy it before they could what a new one? Choices:  A: make B: raise C: entice D: build E: fix<n>Output:		B: raise<n><n>Input: What is something you would not do alone? Choices: <n><n>Output: B: fly<n><n>Input: If they wanted to catch the fish, they would have to first catch them with a what?Choices:  A: net B: hook C: pole D: line E: worms<n>Output: B: hook<n><n>## Solution:<n>```python<n>import re<n><n>def get_answer(q):<n>    """Get answer from question."""<n>    for answer in q.split():<n>        if answer.lower() == q.lower(): return<n>    return None<n>        <n>def check(answer):<n>    """Check given answer is a valid answer."""<n>    if answer == None: return False<n>    if answer in ['B':'raise', 'D':'build']: return True<n>    return False<n><n><n>def run():<n>    # Check answer if match.<n>    for q in q_list:<n>        if not check(get_answer(q)):<n>            print('You got it right', end='\n')<n>            continue<n>        print('You got it wrong', end='\n', file = sys.stderr)<n><n>if __name__ == '__main__':<n>    run()<n>```<n>

How many elements will be in the array after you have placed the last string in it?<n><n>A: 6<n><n>B: 5<n><n>C: 4<n><n>D: 3<n><n>Incorrect answer: C<n><n>Correct Answer<n><n>In the second section, three program examples have been given. Some input data is given for each program's input question. Choose a correct answer and type the letter of the response you have chosen, and then click the Submit Answer button.<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:If I wanted to see a lizard in its natural habitat but I do not speak Spanish, where would I go? Choices:  A: utah B: south america C: new hampshire D: japan E: new mexico<n>Output:		A: utah <n><n>Input: What is a great place to find a cure for cancer? Choices: <n>	A: your bathroom sink B: the north pole C: egypt D: europe E: the bahamas<n>Output: A: your bathroom sink <n><n>Input: Where would a doctor be in the greatest danger when they are driving a car? Choices: 	A: hospital B: clinic C: sidewalk D: nurses home E: car<n>Output: A: car <n><n>#!/bin/bash<n>IN=02<n><n>function get_lines() {<n><n>}<n><n>function remove_space() {<n>    i=1<n>#	i=2<n><n>    for j in `ls x.txt $IN`; do<n>            i=`echo $i $IN| wc -w | awk '{print $1}'`<n>    done<n><n>    echo $i<n>}<n><n><n>function get() {<n><n>	result=`echo $1| sed -e's/.$//g'`<n>	echo $result<n><n>}<n><n><n><n>function cut() {<n><n>	word=$1<n>	<n>	if [[ $2 -le 5 ]]; then<n>	  result=`echo $1 $2| sed -e "s/.*/$word/" | sed -e "s/^[[:space:]]*/[[:space:]]/g"`<n>	  echo $result<n>  else<n>	  result=`sed -e "s/[.,]//g" -e "`echo $1 $3`.sed | sed -e's/^[[:blank:]]*/[[:blank:]]/g' -e s/$word$3/`<n>	  echo $1$word<n>  fi<n><n>}<n><n>#!/bin<n>function show() {<n><n>	echo $2 $3<n><n><n>}<n><n>echo $@<n><n><n>echo "The value of IN ="<n><n>echo $IN<n><n><n>IFS=" "<n><n><n>   <n><n><n><n>#!/bin -e<n><n><n>#!/usr/bin/env python<n><n>#!/bin-e<n>#!/bin/e<n><n>#!/bin/*nix<n><n>#!/bin --args -e<n><n>#!/usr -e<n><n>#! /usr/bin -e bash
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:Sarah opened his chest and found a second heart.  Her patient might not be what? Choices:  A: istanbul B: animal C: antique shop D: human being E: bedroom<n>Output:		A: istanbul<n><n>Input:The chancellor was able to keep himself from laughing at the joke from his visitor but his stomach and face would later let him down. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:Everybody raised a drink and cheered, they were doing what? Choices:  A: were thirsty B: toasting C: getting drunk D: refreshment E: celebrating<n>Output:		B: toasting<n><n>Input: What kind of water to do you want to drink some of? Choices:  a: soda b: distilled water  c: well water  d: hard water  e: rain water<n>Output: B: distilled water<n><n>Input : What kind of water to you drink from? Choices: <n>a: water bottles  b: pitchers  c: ponds  d: rivers  e: sprinklers<n>Output: A: water bottles<n><n>Input: What is the name of the place where you drink out of a glass? Choices:  b: bathroom c: crib  d: dish e: house<n>Output: B: bathroom<n><n>Input: Do you have too many water bottles where you can get a good drink? Choices:  B: yes C: no<n>Output: C: no<n><n>#### Solution:<n>```python<n>#!/usr/bin/python<n><n><n>import sys<n><n>solution=[]<n><n>for line in sys.stdin:<n>    line=line.strip()<n>    <n>    if line=="":<n>        break<n>    <n>    if ':' in line:<n>        pass<n>    else:<n>        solution.append(line)<n>        <n>'''solution should appear as the result:<n><n>A: oil refineries <n>B: toasting<n>B: distilled water<n>B: water bottles <n>B: bathroom<n>B: yes'''<n><n>                <n>sys.stdout.write('\n'.join( str(word) +'' for word in solution))<n><n><n>```

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:John is a human who is in a wheelchair due to an accident.  Where would he go to get to the third floor of his apartment building? Choices:  A: space shuttle B: detroit C: stairs D: downtown E: elevator<n>Output:		A: space shuttles<n><n>### Notes: You need to make an Opposite method - see below<n><n>### Example:<n><n>Input:What do you think I would be doing if I am not doing this exercise? Choices:  a: exercising b: walking up stairs C: studying d: studying in class e: doing homework<n>Output: a: exercising<n><n>#### Question:<n><n>- We are given a string with an index and asked to write code to print its characters in reverse<n><n>- This is an example of when we would use the `list.remove()` method.<n><n>#### Solution:<n><n>First, we set the variable index, which holds the current index of the string.<n><n>Next, we iterate through the string, using a `for` loop. In each iteration, we check whether the current index value is greater than  `string.index`, which is equal to the string's length. If the index is greater than the string's length, means that we just visited last character and we don't have anything to print.<n><n>If the index isn't greater than the string' length, it means that we have something to print. Now we only need to find out which character to print, based on the current index:<n><n>- The first character of the string is at index 0, so it will always be at index 0. So in every iteration we need to check whether the index is 0 or not.<n><n>- The last character of the string are at index  `string_length-1`, so we will be only checking it when we go through the string for the last time.<n><n>- Between those two cases we only need to check whether the current index is greater or less than the index of the current character in the string.<n><n>- If the current index is less than the index of current character, it means that we need to print the character at the current index, so we will use `.char_at()` to retrieve that character.<n><n>- If it is greater, we need to print the next character from the current index, so the `.next()` method will be used to retrieve the next charater.<n><n>- At last, we check if the `list.remove(...)` method should be used to remove the current character.<n><n>- The character can be removed only if:<n><n>- the index of the char

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:Where do fish spend the majority of their time? Choices:  A: body of water B: lake superior C: underwater D: toilet E: aquarium<n>Output:		A: body of water<n><n>Input:What do you typically do when you have a cold? Choices: <n>A: open the windows C: Take medication D: have a hot tea in the shower E: take a bath  <n><n>Output: A: Take medication<n>```<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the question.<n><n>You may wish to review the instructions before answering this question.<n><n>There are several ways to answer this question. Here are a few:<n>1. Open the Windows to let in air.<n>2. Drink medication to relieve<n>symptoms.<n>3. Have a hot tea in the Shower.<n><n>I think this choice is correct. <n>```<n><n>## Explanation:<n><n>This part explains why this question is correct.<n><n>```<n>Answer:<n>1. Opening the Windows to let in fresh air works during the summer, but does not solve the cold weather problem during the winter.<n>2. Taking medication to relieve cold symptoms is another way to treat your cold. However, it is not always necessary to open the windows unless it is very dusty and needs additional purification.<n>3. It is a good idea to take a hot tea bath to relax your muscles, and to get your body a good amount of moisture. In addition, it relieves your symptoms.<n><n>```

Choices: A to Boston, B to Washington, C: to Texas, D: New York, E: to Florida<n>Output: A: to Boston<n><n>Input:  What country was George Washington born in? Choices: A) England, B: France, C: Canada, D: America, E: Spain<n>Output: A: America<n><n>#### Question 1:<n>```<n>The name of the data type I chose is boolean value.<n>The most common use of boolean data type is to indicate whether a condition is satisfied for a test operation.<n>```<n><n>#### Question 2:<n>```<n>The most common use for variables in the C programming language is to hold information that is needed by a specific program.<n><n>The name of the type of a non-negative integer whose value is determined by the number of characters in a string is character constant.<n><n>The most common use in Java for variables is similar to what the name of the C programming language represents: data storage<n><n>```

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:You'd add pepper and salt to what liquid meal if it's bland? Choices:  A: supermarket B: water C: cellars D: soup E: grocery store<n>Output:		B: water<n>#### My solution<n><n>#### 1. What is wrong?<n><n>```<n>>>> b = [{'home': {'water' : 0}} for x in range(4)]<n>>>> b[0].update(dict(water=1))<n>>>> b[1].update(dict(home=0))<n>>>> b.append(dict(supermarket=1))<n>>>>[{'soup' : 0,'supermarket' : 1, 'water' : 1}, {'home' : 0,...}, '{bland' : 1},... <type 'list'>]<n>```<n><n><n>#### 2. Improve it<n>```<n>>>> home = b[0:2] <n>>>> supermarket = b[2:4]<n>>>> salt=home[0]['water']<n>>>> home.pop(0)<n>>>> soup = supermarket[0]<n>>>> for water,home in zip(soup['water'],home):<n>...       if (water == 0):<n>...           home['water'] = home['water'] + salt<n>...<n>>>> home<n>[(1, {'bland':'0', 'water':'1'})]<n>>>> supermarket<n>[(0, {'water' : 1})]<n>```<n><n>#### 3. Make it faster<n><n>```<n>>>>[{'groceries' : 0}, None,...]<n>>>> soup=supermarket[0]<n><n>>>> for water in soup['water']:<n>...       if water == 0:<n>...           home=home.append(soup)<n>...           break<n>>>> home<n>(2, {'bland': 0, 'water': 1})<n>```<n><n><n><n><n><n>### Instruction:Answer the previous question and the following questions.<n><n>**1. How many elements is your home?**<n><n>```<n>>> type(b)<n><class 'list'><n>>> len(b)<n>1<n>>> type(home)<n><class 'tuple'><n>>> len(home)<n>1<n>>> len(supermarket)<n>1<n>```<n><n>**2. How many items in the supermarket?**<n><n>```python<n>>> map(len, supermarket)<n>[1]<n>```<n><n>**3.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:What do people want to do when they love a place that they are going on vacation in? Choices:  A: pleasant thoughts B: overspending C: moving there D: staying there E: debt<n>Output:		B: overspensing<n><n>### Your Solution<n>```<n>import java.io.*;<n>import java.util.*;<n>public class LeetCode4_input_stream {<n>  <n>  private static void solve1(BufferedReader reader, PrintWriter writer, Scanner scanner, HashMap<String, Boolean> visited) {<n>    String input = reader.readLine().replace("\\", "");<n>    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(input);<n>    while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {<n>      String words = st.nextToken().toLowerCase();<n>      String[] parts = words.split(",");<n>      if (parts.length == 2) {<n>        String word1 = getWord(parts[0], visited);<n>        String word2 = getWord(parts.length > 1? parts[1] : "", visited); <n>        if (!(word1.equals(word2))) {<n>          writer.println(word1); <n>        }<n>      }<n>    }<n>  }<n>  private static String getWord(String word, HashMap<String,Boolean> visited) {<n><n>    return visited.get(word) == null? word : (null);<n>  }<n>  <n>  public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {<n>    <n>    BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in));<n>    PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(System.out);<n>    Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);<n>    HashMap<String, Boolean > visited = new HashMap<String, Boolean>();<n>    String choice = scanner.next();<n>    switch (choice) {<n>      case "A": SolveA(reader, visitor); break;<n>      case "B": SolveB(reader, visitor);  break;<n>      case ("C"): SolveC(reader, visitor);<n>        break;<n>      case  "D" : SolveD(reader, visitor);break;<n>      case "E": SolveE(reader, visitor);      break;<n>    }<n>    }<n>    <n>    <n>    private static void SolveA(BufferedReader reader, PrintWriter writer) {<n>      solve1(reader, writer, scanner, visited); // solve first letter<n>      solve1( reader, writer, scanner,

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:A person is putting on makeup, what is their likely goal? Choices:  ( A ) look at the clock ( B ) rub their eyes ( C ) grab the phone ( D ) take a deep breath ( E ) doze off<n>Output: A:look at the clock<n><n>Input: A person is putting on make up what is their likely goal? Choices:  A : feel pleasure B: look atractive C: compliments  D: interesting experiences E : joy<n>Output: B : look attractive<n><n>## Author: Shengli Xiao<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the multiple choice question.<n>First, I thought there will be only five choice, but there are six.<n>1.If I am thirsty, I woud go to water fountain, or I find a place that provide me clean water.<n>2.I think A is the possible answer if I want to look beautiful.<n>3."A" is the possible answer if the person is not awake yet.<n>4."A" is the likely answer if I want to awake completely.<n>5.I think "B" is the appropriate answer.<n>6.I choose "C"<n>7.I think the appropriate answer is "C", because I don't know if I dozing off when I want to take a look at my phone.<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:James kept a clipboard where he could easily find  it.  Where might he keep it? Choices:  A: shelf B: place of work C: desk D: office supply store E: school<n>Output:		A: shelf<n><n>Input: Where would you expect to find a good source of water in order to fill a jug? Choices: <n><n>A: on a farm<n><n>B: in a restaurant<n><n>C: at a waterfall<n><n>D: at home<n><n>Output:A: on a farm <n><n>Input: Some people like to take long walks while  others prefer a fast-paced <n>stroll. Choices:<n><n>A: going to work every day<n><n>B: on a hike<n><n>C: to a restaurant<n><n>D: on vacation<n><n>Output:B: on a hiik<n><n>Input: The students were asked to find what is on the opposite side of up. Choices: A: down B: outside C: behind D: around E: next to<n>Output: A: down<n><n>Input: Where are the people in this sentence going when they leave their house? Choices:<n><n>1. To the store<n><n>2. To the beach<n><n>3. To work<n><n>4. To the store<n> <n>5. To the beach<n>```<n><n>Answer: I believe you should try out Regex here. You can use regex.Match to create a match and regex.Groups to find the group number of the match.<n><n>Here is a sample I made to find if the string contains 'in' or 'on'<n><n>```C#<n>string line="Hello, world!";<n>string reg = @"\W[a-z]{3}\W";   <n>string regex ="(?i)"+reg ;<n>string find = regex.ToString(); <n><n>Match match = Regex.Match(line, regex);<n>if (match.Groups[1].Value.ToString() == "on")<n>                Console.WriteLine("1");<n>            else if (match.Groups[2].Value.ToString()== "in")<n>                Console.Write("2");<n>          <n>        else<n>            Console.WriteLine("doesn't contain");<n><n>```

If he/she answered 80% of the questions correctly, what number of questions does he/she answer incorrectly? Choices:  B. 50% 	C. 30% D. 10% E. 20%<n>Output: B. 50%. Because you take the percentage of the number of question answered correctly ( 80% ) then multiply by the remaining number of questions left to be answered ( 80% of 80 questions), the answer will show up 50%.<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:What is a student about to do if they are sitting in front of a number of black and white keys? Choices:  A: talk B: read book C: play piano D: study book E: study engineering<n>Output:		C: play piano<n><n>Input: How is there no food or drink available in some situations in your home? Choices: 	A: during a test B. C: if you are thirst E: D: A: during a test<n><n>Output: E: If you are thirst<n><n>### Solution:<n>```<n><n>#!/bin/bash<n><n>while read line<n>    do<n>	case "#$line" in <n>	""| *[]) echo "A: none" ;;	<n>	*[]) echo "A: $line" ;;			                                               <n>	"[") echo "B: none" ;;				                                       <n>	"{") echo "C: none" ;;	                                                       <n>        "//") echo "D: none" ;;	    	                                        <n>	"#") echo "E: none" ;;	 		                                          <n>	*)<n>   	  s=$(( ($#)) );<n>	while $s > 1<n>	do <n>	  	case "$line[$s-1]" in #$line[$s-1]<n>	  	  0) echo "A: 1" ;;		<n>	  	  ) echo "B: 1" ;;    <n>	  	  *[]) echo "C: $line[$s-1], 1"; <n>                    shift<n>                        ;;<n>	  	1) echo "D: 1";<n>                         ;;<n>	  	2) echo "A: $s, 2"; <n>                         ;;<n>   	  *)  echo "D: $line[$s]"<n>                shift<n>                        ;;   <n>	#) echo "A:2" ;;<n><n>	  s=$((($s-1)))<n>                ;;<n>	esac<n>	shift<n>	done<n>             ;; <n>    esac<n>done <<< $*<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:What should the bean bag chair sit on? Choices:  A: house B: den C: family room D: wood E: floor<n>Output:		A: house<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>* A: oil refineris<n>* Where could you find some pumbaing that would not be useful to you if you are sober? answer:<n>```python<n>  def question(p):<n> # A:  oil refineries<n> # B: wall<n> # C: show<n> # D: own home<n> # E: water fountin<n>   # A: Oil refineries (So I shouldnt go to the oil refineries if I am sober).<n>   # B: wall (A wall is the home for a sober person.)<n>   # C: show (If I go to the show and get drunk, I wouldn't care if it's my own home)<n>   # D: own home (It would be useful if you're at your own home, so it's wrong. )<n>   # E: water founation (It would be useful for if you were thirsty, so it's the correct answer)<n>   p=p.upper()<n>   if (p=="THIRSTY"):<n>      if (p=="WATER FOUNTAIN"):<n>           return("E")<n>      return("E")<n>   return("A")<n>```<n><n>* A: house<n>* Where could you sit that would not be useful if you are drunk? answer:<n>```<n>  def question(s):<n>    # A: The floor, bc that's where you normally sit sober<n>    # B: The den, bc that' so where you normally go to get drunk<n>    # C: The living room, bc that' where you drunk hang out<n>    # D: The table, bc that' were you normally sit drunk<n>    # E: The kitchen, bc you get drunk to cook food<n>    s=s.upper()<n>    if (s=="SOBER"):<n>        if (s=="FLOOR" ):<n>            return("A")<n>        if (s==="DEN"):<n>            return("B")<n>        if ( s=="LIVING ROOM" ):<n>            print("C")<n>        elif (s=="TABLE" ):<n>            if (s=="DRUNK"):<n>                return("D")<n>        return("E")<n>

Choices:  C: on netflix B: on youtube E: on hulu D: on tv A: on torrent<n>Output: B: on youtub<n><br><n>## Instruction: Answer the following free response questions. Each question's prompt can be considered as a new prompt line, and each question can have its own prompt.<n>You want to create a simple website to track how many movies you see on average every year. You need to add a table to the home page to list each year with the average movies seen over that year, as shown below.<br><n>![image of home page of simple website to track movie viewings](./examples/example.jpg)<br><b>Example Output</b><br>You averaged around 16 movies per year. <br>Year|Average Movies<br>2011: 15<br>2020: 15<p><br><b>Input</b><br>Enter the years and the number of movies watched for each year separated by commas:<br>5|30|10<p><b>Output</b><n>```<n>Year|Average Mov<n>2011:15<n>2020:15<n>```<n>```<n>### Answer the following free response question.  <n>Greetings, humans! Welcome to our planet, where we would like to keep some things a secret. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:Who designs a building? Choices:  A: builders B: driver C: architect D: fall down E: tradesmen<n>Output:		B: drivers<n><n>#My Solution<n>   import os<n>    filename = 'input.txt'<n>    file = open(filename, 'rt')<n>    for line in file:<n>        if 'output:' in line:<n>            #print(line)<n>            start=line[line.index(':')+1:].replace('\n ', '')<n>            name=''.join(start).lower()<n>            choices=start.split(' ')<n>            name, choices = [choice for choice in choices if choice!='']<n>            name='\n'.join(name.split())<n>            choices.sort()<n>            print('Input: ',' '.join(str(choice).lower() for choice in choices))<n>            print('Output: ', name.title())<n>            <n>          <n>#TestCase 1: <n>Input:Where could you find some pluming that would not be of  use to you if you  are thirsty?<n>Choices:  A:  oil refineries B :  wall C  : show D  : own home E :  water fountain<n><n><n>Input: <n>Who designs a building? <n>Choices: A: builders B :  drivers C : architect D :  fall down <n>E: tradesmen<n><n>Outout:<n>A: builders<n><n>#Code Implementation<n><n>#Code Review:<n><n>## What went right? <n>- I got to the final test case successfully<n><n>## What went wrong? <n>- The formatting for code was messed up and I didn't have any comments where it said to. (Mom) also she said this didn't make sense to her and that makes sense cause there is a lot of if statements that could have multiple outcomes. <n><n>## What did you learn? <n>- I learned about if statements and how to use them, I learned about how to use multiple functions in one file and how to open a file. <n>- I also learned how to get a file to open and make comments without using the preprocessed file.<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:What would a camper need to do before he or she can start cooking food? Choices:  A: make breakfast B: go hiking C: pack or bag D: light fire E: grab a match<n>Output:		A: pack or bag <n>Input:Which of the following items is NOT found in some common kitchens? Choices:  a) chest freezer b) microwave oven c) fireplace d) electric clock e) chest freezer<n>Output: e: chest freezer<n><n>Instruction:Your output should match the correct choice, NOT be a new problem statement.<n><n>#!/usr/bin/python<n><n>import fileinput<n><n>problems = [<n>		['What would a camper',"make breakfast", "go hiking", 'pack or bag', "light fire"],<n>		['Where could you', "oil refineries", "wall",'show', "water fountain"]<n>	]<n><n>#print problems <n><n>def solve(solutions, problem):<n>	a = -1<n>	b = 5<n>	c = 0<n>	for i in problem:<n>		if c == 0:<n>			c = i<n>		else:<n>			if c == problem[i]:<n>				print c<n>			c += 1<n>		if c>=0:<n>		<n>		<n>	<n>def ask_for_input():<n>	problem = problems[0]<n>	answer = solutions.pop(0)<n>	for i in range(len(problem)):<n>		if problem[i]!= answer:<n>			answer += 1<n>	answer = int(answer - 1)<n>	solutions.append(answer)<n>	answer_string = ', '.join([str(i) for i in range(len())])[1:]<n>	print(answer_string)<n><n><n>answer = 4<n>ask_for_input()<n>ask_for_output()<n><n>solve(solutions, problem)<n>

Choices:  A:{ } B: in C: like D: a E: as<n>Output: D: as<n><n>Input:In 2020, a study found that if college freshmen were given a 400 word essay to write in a foreign language, they were only 50% as productive as their non-native English counterparts. Choices:  { } A: swim B: the C: go D: beach E: down<n>Output: B: the<n><n>---<n>### Question:<n><n>Output: Choices: { } A: swimming B: The C: swims D: beach E: goes<n><n>---<n>## Solution:<n><n>#### Java<n><n>```java<n>static class Solution {<n>    public String translate(String s) {<n>        char[] charArray = s.toCharArray();<n>        <n>        if (charArray.contains(" ")) {<n>            int count = 0;<n>            for (int i = 0; i < charArray.length; i++) {<n>                if (!(Character.isSpaceChar(charArray[i]) || charArray[i] == '\n')) {<n>                    count++;<n>                }<n>            }<n>            while (count!= s.length()) {<n>                for (int i = count, j = 0; j < charArray.length && i < charArray.Length; j++) {<n>                    charArray[i] = charArray[j];<n>                    i++;<n>                }<n>                charArray[i]  ='';<n>                count++;<n>            }<n>        } <n>        <n>        StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder(); <n>        <n>        for (int i = charArray.Length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {<n>            if (Character.isLowerCase(charArray[i])) {<n>                charArray[charArray.Length - 2 - i] = Character.toUpperCase(charArray[charArray.length -
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:Jame's bare feet were burned as he walked, because the sunshine had made the surface hot.  Where might he have been? Choices:  A: disneyland B: snow C: windowsill D: street E: summer<n>Output:		A: disneyland<n><n>#### Solution:<n><n>```python<n>def main():<n>    q=[{"text":"Where could you find some plumbbing that would not be  of use to  you i f you are thirsty",choices=[{"text":"A","ans":"A"},{"text":"B","ans":"B"},{"text":"C","ans":"C"},{"text":"D","ans":"D"},{"text":"E","ans":"E"}]},{<n>       "text":"Jame's bare  feet  were burned as he  walked",choices=[{"ans":"A"},{"ans":"B"},{"ans":"C"},{"ans":"D"},{"ans":"E"}]<n>   }]<n>    correctans=solver(q);<n><n>    for(q[0]["choices"] in range(len(correctans)-1)):<n>        q[1]["choices"]=correctans;<n>        q[0]["choice"]=correctans[q[0]["qustion"][:-1]["text"]][q[0]["choice"]]["text"]<n><n>    for i in range(len(q[0] ["ans"])):<n>        input="q[0]["qst"]""print(input)"+ str(q[0]['ans'][i])<n>    q[1]["ans"]= input<n>    print(q[0]="q[1]")<n><n>```<n>solve some more problems:<n>https://github.com/CraigBroadley/CodingDojo/blob/master/adventofcode/2020/year/Day18.py<n>

Machine Learning<n>2. Supervised Machine Learning<n>3. Unsupervised Machine Learning<n>4. Reinforced Learning<n>5. Semantic Understanding<n><n>## ML Models<n>### Supervised Models<n>- Linear models<n>- Logistic regression<n>- Naive Bayes<n>- Neural Networks<n>- K Nearest Neighbors (KNN)<n>- Decision Trees <n><n>- KNN<n>- Naive Bayesian<n>- Linear Regression<n>- Support Vector Machine (SVM)<n>- Neural Network<n><n>### Unsupervised Models<n>- Density-Based Spatial Clustering (DBSCAN)<n>- Autoencoders(AE)<n>- Kohonen Network (KNN)<n><n>### Applications<n>1. Data Classification<n>2. Prediction<n>3. Data clustering<n>4. Anomaly detection<n><n># References<n>1. [Coursera-Machine Learning for Trading](https://www.coursera.org/learn/machine-learning-trading)<n>

Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input:Sometimes fighting inflation isn't even what, because it is so negligible?
